body.p: Explain why we can use the normal approximation in this case, and state which normal distribution you would use for the approximation.

explanation.p: X is binomial with n = 225 and p = 0.1. The normal approximation is appropriate, since the rule of thumb is satisfied: np = 225 * 0.1 = 22.5 > 10, and n(1 − p) = 225 * 0.9 = 202.5 > 10.

We will approximate the binomial random variable X by the random variable Y having a normal distribution with mean μ = 225 * 0.1 = 22.5 and standard deviation σ = √(225 * 0.1 * 0.9) = sqrt(20.25) = 4.5.
